articles.description: France striker Kylian Mbappe tells Paris St-Germain he intends to leave the club at the end of the season.
articles.title: Mbappe tells PSG he intends to leave the club

articles.description: England will rue the chances missed on day one of the third Test in India, says former captain Michael Vaughan.
articles.title: England will rue missed chances, says Vaughan

articles.description: Crystal Palace are set to sack manager Roy Hodgson, with former Eintracht Frankfurt boss Oliver Glasner a strong favourite to take the job.
articles.title: Palace set to sack manager Hodgson

articles.description: Detroit Pistons player Isaiah Stewart is arrested for assault after punching Phoenix Suns' Drew Eubanks before their teams played on Wednesday.
articles.title: Isaiah Stewart: Detroit Pistons player arrested after punching Phoenix Suns' Drew Eubanks

articles.description: Super Bowl winners Kansas City Chiefs say they are saddened by the "senseless act of violence" after a shooting at their victory parade on Wednesday.
articles.title: Kansas City Chiefs parade shooting: Super Bowl winners saddened by 'senseless act of violence'

articles.description: Fifteen-time major champion Tiger Woods says he is 'pain-free' before his first PGA Tour event of 2024.
articles.title: Tiger Woods 'pain-free' before PGA Tour return at Genesis Invitational

articles.description: Newcastle United sporting director Dan Ashworth is approached by Manchester United about a move to Old Trafford.
articles.title: Newcastle director Ashworth approached by Man Utd

articles.description: Kevin Durant scores 25 points to lead the Phoenix Suns to a 116-100 win over the Detroit Pistons.
articles.title: NBA round-up: Kevin Durant stars with 25 points as Phoenix Suns beat Detroit Pistons

articles.description: Rohit Sharma and Ravindra Jadeja hit centuries to take India to 326-5 after England had started well on day one of the third Test in Rajkot.
articles.title: Rohit & Jadeja make centuries to repel England

articles.description: The Pakistan Cricket Board terminates fast bowler Haris Rauf's central contract after he refused to go on the Test tour of Australia.
articles.title: Pakistan end Rauf's contract for Australia tour refusal
